source_payload.html:
User:MauraWen/sandbox Jewel box added to category

← Previous revision Revision as of 22:04, 9 February 2026
Line 53: Line 53:
"Located at the intersection of Wells and McKinley Drives within the 1,293-acre Forest Park, this Art Deco greenhouse was designed by engineer William Becker and completed in 1936 with assistance from the Public Works Administration. Public floral conservatories gained popularity in the city in the 1910s, when pollution and smog threatened much of the city’s flora. City gardener John Moritz was tasked with exhibiting pollution-resistant plants in greenhouse displays for public enjoyment. The first such greenhouse, nicknamed the Jewel Box, proved wildly popular and inspired more elaborate seasonal exhibits throughout the 1920s. In 1933, Mayor Bernard Dickmann allocated $75,000 to erect a larger, permanent greenhouse. Becker, then St. Louis' chief engineer, studied climate patterns to produce a design measuring 144 feet long and 55 feet wide, with more than 4,000 glass wall panes set into wood and iron supports, and five stepped levels of wood roofing with glass clerestories. The design also includes three reflecting pools south of the structure, along with a network of footpaths connecting the greenhouse to the park’s existing pedestrian routes. Inside, the space accommodates rotating floral exhibits. The structure, officially designated as the Jewel Box, opened in 1936. Seasonal displays (e.g. chrysanthemums, lilies, azalea) continue to attract visitors.<ref name="TCL" />
"Located at the intersection of Wells and McKinley Drives within the 1,293-acre Forest Park, this Art Deco greenhouse was designed by engineer William Becker and completed in 1936 with assistance from the Public Works Administration. Public floral conservatories gained popularity in the city in the 1910s, when pollution and smog threatened much of the city’s flora. City gardener John Moritz was tasked with exhibiting pollution-resistant plants in greenhouse displays for public enjoyment. The first such greenhouse, nicknamed the Jewel Box, proved wildly popular and inspired more elaborate seasonal exhibits throughout the 1920s. In 1933, Mayor Bernard Dickmann allocated $75,000 to erect a larger, permanent greenhouse. Becker, then St. Louis' chief engineer, studied climate patterns to produce a design measuring 144 feet long and 55 feet wide, with more than 4,000 glass wall panes set into wood and iron supports, and five stepped levels of wood roofing with glass clerestories. The design also includes three reflecting pools south of the structure, along with a network of footpaths connecting the greenhouse to the park’s existing pedestrian routes. Inside, the space accommodates rotating floral exhibits. The structure, officially designated as the Jewel Box, opened in 1936. Seasonal displays (e.g. chrysanthemums, lilies, azalea) continue to attract visitors.<ref name="TCL" />


Following city budget cuts in the 1990s, local volunteer groups formed partnerships with the city department of parks and recreation to maintain the landscape setting surrounding the Jewel Box, including the lily ponds within the reflecting pools and beds lining the pedestrian paths. A $3.5 million renovation of the structure was completed in 2002, with SWT Design landscape architects. The Jewel Box was listed in the National Register of Historic Places in 2000."<ref name="TCL">{{cite web |title=Forest Park–Jewel Box |url=https://www.tclf.org/forest-park-jewel-box |website=Cultural Landscape foundation |access-date=9 February 2026}}</ref>


"The Jewel Box is a display greenhouse located at the intersection of Wells Drive and McKinley Drive in Forest Park, St. Louis. The Jewel Box itself rests on a rock-faced ashlar foundation laid with dark mortar above, vertical glass walls rise to five stepped, flat-roofed levels. 16,664 square feet of double-strength Libbey-Owens-Ford plate glass in some panes were set into a system of wood and wrought iron supports.
"The Jewel Box is a display greenhouse located at the intersection of Wells Drive and McKinley Drive in Forest Park, St. Louis. The Jewel Box itself rests on a rock-faced ashlar foundation laid with dark mortar above, vertical glass walls rise to five stepped, flat-roofed levels. 16,664 square feet of double-strength Libbey-Owens-Ford plate glass in some panes were set into a system of wood and wrought iron supports.

source_payload.html:
Architecture

← Previous revision Revision as of 22:04, 9 February 2026
Line 53: Line 53:
"Located at the intersection of Wells and McKinley Drives within the 1,293-acre Forest Park, this Art Deco greenhouse was designed by engineer William Becker and completed in 1936 with assistance from the Public Works Administration. Public floral conservatories gained popularity in the city in the 1910s, when pollution and smog threatened much of the city’s flora. City gardener John Moritz was tasked with exhibiting pollution-resistant plants in greenhouse displays for public enjoyment. The first such greenhouse, nicknamed the Jewel Box, proved wildly popular and inspired more elaborate seasonal exhibits throughout the 1920s. In 1933, Mayor Bernard Dickmann allocated $75,000 to erect a larger, permanent greenhouse. Becker, then St. Louis' chief engineer, studied climate patterns to produce a design measuring 144 feet long and 55 feet wide, with more than 4,000 glass wall panes set into wood and iron supports, and five stepped levels of wood roofing with glass clerestories. The design also includes three reflecting pools south of the structure, along with a network of footpaths connecting the greenhouse to the park’s existing pedestrian routes. Inside, the space accommodates rotating floral exhibits. The structure, officially designated as the Jewel Box, opened in 1936. Seasonal displays (e.g. chrysanthemums, lilies, azalea) continue to attract visitors.<ref name="TCL" />
"Located at the intersection of Wells and McKinley Drives within the 1,293-acre Forest Park, this Art Deco greenhouse was designed by engineer William Becker and completed in 1936 with assistance from the Public Works Administration. Public floral conservatories gained popularity in the city in the 1910s, when pollution and smog threatened much of the city’s flora. City gardener John Moritz was tasked with exhibiting pollution-resistant plants in greenhouse displays for public enjoyment. The first such greenhouse, nicknamed the Jewel Box, proved wildly popular and inspired more elaborate seasonal exhibits throughout the 1920s. In 1933, Mayor Bernard Dickmann allocated $75,000 to erect a larger, permanent greenhouse. Becker, then St. Louis' chief engineer, studied climate patterns to produce a design measuring 144 feet long and 55 feet wide, with more than 4,000 glass wall panes set into wood and iron supports, and five stepped levels of wood roofing with glass clerestories. The design also includes three reflecting pools south of the structure, along with a network of footpaths connecting the greenhouse to the park’s existing pedestrian routes. Inside, the space accommodates rotating floral exhibits. The structure, officially designated as the Jewel Box, opened in 1936. Seasonal displays (e.g. chrysanthemums, lilies, azalea) continue to attract visitors.<ref name="TCL" />


Following city budget cuts in the 1990s, local volunteer groups formed partnerships with the city department of parks and recreation to maintain the landscape setting surrounding the Jewel Box, including the lily ponds within the reflecting pools and beds lining the pedestrian paths. A $3.5 million renovation of the structure was completed in 2002, with SWT Design landscape architects. The Jewel Box was listed in the National Register of Historic Places in 2000."<ref name="TCL">{{cite web |title=Forest Park–Jewel Box |url=https://www.tclf.org/forest-park-jewel-box |website=Cultural Landscape foundation |access-date=9 February 2026}}</ref>


"The Jewel Box is a display greenhouse located at the intersection of Wells Drive and McKinley Drive in Forest Park, St. Louis. The Jewel Box itself rests on a rock-faced ashlar foundation laid with dark mortar above, vertical glass walls rise to five stepped, flat-roofed levels. 16,664 square feet of double-strength Libbey-Owens-Ford plate glass in some panes were set into a system of wood and wrought iron supports.
"The Jewel Box is a display greenhouse located at the intersection of Wells Drive and McKinley Drive in Forest Park, St. Louis. The Jewel Box itself rests on a rock-faced ashlar foundation laid with dark mortar above, vertical glass walls rise to five stepped, flat-roofed levels. 16,664 square feet of double-strength Libbey-Owens-Ford plate glass in some panes were set into a system of wood and wrought iron supports.

The Bombay sandwich is a vegetarian sandwich consisting of two or three slices of [[white bread]] with their crusts cut off, spread with [[butter]] and a green [[chutney]], and filled with boiled [[potato]]es and raw vegetables.<ref name="Vijayakar">{{Cite news |last=Vijayakar |first=Kunal |author-link=Kunal Vijaykar |date=27 November 2022 |title=What the Fork: What Makes the Bombay Sandwich a Truly Mumbai Dish, Writes Kunal Vijayakar |url=https://www.news18.com/news/lifestyle/what-the-fork-what-makes-the-bombay-sandwich-a-truly-mumbai-dish-writes-kunal-vijayakar-6480733.html |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[News18]] |archive-date=26 July 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250726112114/https://www.news18.com/news/lifestyle/what-the-fork-what-makes-the-bombay-sandwich-a-truly-mumbai-dish-writes-kunal-vijayakar-6480733.html |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="Nath">{{Cite news |last=Nath |first=Aatish |date=18 June 2025 |title=The Coolest Restaurants in Mumbai Have a Secret—and It’s Hiding between Two Slices of Bread |url=https://www.vogue.in/content/the-coolest-restaurants-in-mumbai-have-a-secret-and-its-hiding-between-two-slices-of-bread |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[Vogue India]]}}</ref> The sandwich uses vegetables such as [[onion]] slices, [[cucumber]]s, [[tomato]]es, [[capsicum]]s, and [[beetroot]],<ref name="Ramadurai">{{Cite news |last=Ramadurai |first=Charukesi |date=29 September 2023 |title=The Incomparable Bombay Sandwich |url=https://www.bbc.com/travel/article/20230929-the-incomparable-bombay-sandwich |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[BBC News]] |archive-date=30 January 2026 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20260130100148/https://www.bbc.com/travel/article/20230929-the-incomparable-bombay-sandwich |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="Menon">{{Cite news |last=Menon |first=Smitha |date=2 July 2020 |title=Is the Bombay Sandwich Really from Mumbai? |url=https://www.cntraveller.in/story/bombay-sandwich-recipe-where-to-eat-mumbai-food/ |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[Condé Nast Traveller]] |archive-date=1 September 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250901134656/https://www.cntraveller.in/story/bombay-sandwich-recipe-where-to-eat-mumbai-food/ |url-status=live }}</ref> and it is seasoned with salt and [[chaat masala]] or [[mango powder]], or with a proprietary blend of spices.<ref name="Vijayakar" /><ref name="Nath" /> The chutney is made with [[pudina]] and [[coriander leaf]].<ref name="Menon" /> The sandwich commonly uses [[Wibs]] brand bread, which is large and soft.<ref name="Vijayakar" /><ref name="Menon" />
The Bombay sandwich is a vegetarian sandwich consisting of two or three slices of [[white bread]] with their crusts cut off, spread with [[butter]] and a green [[chutney]], and filled with boiled [[potato]]es and raw vegetables.<ref name="Vijayakar">{{Cite news |last=Vijayakar |first=Kunal |author-link=Kunal Vijaykar |date=27 November 2022 |title=What the Fork: What Makes the Bombay Sandwich a Truly Mumbai Dish, Writes Kunal Vijayakar |url=https://www.news18.com/news/lifestyle/what-the-fork-what-makes-the-bombay-sandwich-a-truly-mumbai-dish-writes-kunal-vijayakar-6480733.html |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[News18]] |archive-date=26 July 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250726112114/https://www.news18.com/news/lifestyle/what-the-fork-what-makes-the-bombay-sandwich-a-truly-mumbai-dish-writes-kunal-vijayakar-6480733.html |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="Nath">{{Cite news |last=Nath |first=Aatish |date=18 June 2025 |title=The Coolest Restaurants in Mumbai Have a Secret—and It’s Hiding between Two Slices of Bread |url=https://www.vogue.in/content/the-coolest-restaurants-in-mumbai-have-a-secret-and-its-hiding-between-two-slices-of-bread |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[Vogue India]]}}</ref> The sandwich uses vegetables such as [[onion]] slices, [[cucumber]]s, [[tomato]]es, [[capsicum]]s, and [[beetroot]],<ref name="Ramadurai">{{Cite news |last=Ramadurai |first=Charukesi |date=29 September 2023 |title=The Incomparable Bombay Sandwich |url=https://www.bbc.com/travel/article/20230929-the-incomparable-bombay-sandwich |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[BBC News]] |archive-date=30 January 2026 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20260130100148/https://www.bbc.com/travel/article/20230929-the-incomparable-bombay-sandwich |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="Menon">{{Cite news |last=Menon |first=Smitha |date=2 July 2020 |title=Is the Bombay Sandwich Really from Mumbai? |url=https://www.cntraveller.in/story/bombay-sandwich-recipe-where-to-eat-mumbai-food/ |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[Condé Nast Traveller]] |archive-date=1 September 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250901134656/https://www.cntraveller.in/story/bombay-sandwich-recipe-where-to-eat-mumbai-food/ |url-status=live }}</ref> and it is seasoned with salt and [[chaat masala]] or [[mango powder]], or with a proprietary blend of spices.<ref name="Vijayakar" /><ref name="Nath" /> The chutney is made with [[pudina]] and [[coriander leaf]].<ref name="Menon" /> The sandwich commonly uses [[Wibs]] brand bread, which is large and soft.<ref name="Vijayakar" /><ref name="Menon" />


The sandwich is often toasted, traditionally done by holding it over a flame with a [[chimta (tool)|chimta]], though some sandwich vendors, as well as restaurants, use electric [[sandwich toaster]]s.<ref name="Ramadurai" /><ref name="Menon" /> This gives it a texture that is soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside.<ref name="Ramadurai" /> The large sandwich is cut into four or six slices.<ref name="Vijayakar" /> It is often topped with [[grated cheese]],<ref name="Ramadurai" /> while some versions top it with crunchy [[sev (food)|sev]].<ref name="Vijayakar" /><ref name="Menon" /> Street vendors serve the sandwich with [[ketchup]] on [[paper plate]]s.<ref name="Ramadurai" /> It may be served hot<ref>{{Cite news |last=Promod |first=Sheba |date=22 December 2012 |title=Hot Food on a Cold Day |url=https://www.thehindu.com/features/magazine/hot-food-on-a-cold-day/article4221500.ece |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[The Hindu]]}}</ref> or cold.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Sanghvi |first=Vir |author-link=Vir Sanghvi |date=12 July 2020 |title=Rude Food by Vir Sanghvi: Roll Redemption |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/brunch/rude-food-by-vir-sanghvi-roll-redemption/story-WLkxCkUTD0BSDcINWNAALI.html |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[Hindustan Times]] |archive-date=24 October 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221024034732/https://www.hindustantimes.com/brunch/rude-food-by-vir-sanghvi-roll-redemption/story-WLkxCkUTD0BSDcINWNAALI.html |url-status=live }}</ref>
The sandwich is often toasted, traditionally done by holding it over a flame with a [[Pie iron|chimta]], though some sandwich vendors, as well as restaurants, use electric [[sandwich toaster]]s.<ref name="Ramadurai" /><ref name="Menon" /> This gives it a texture that is soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside.<ref name="Ramadurai" /> The large sandwich is cut into four or six slices.<ref name="Vijayakar" /> It is often topped with [[grated cheese]],<ref name="Ramadurai" /> while some versions top it with crunchy [[sev (food)|sev]].<ref name="Vijayakar" /><ref name="Menon" /> Street vendors serve the sandwich with [[ketchup]] on [[paper plate]]s.<ref name="Ramadurai" /> It may be served hot<ref>{{Cite news |last=Promod |first=Sheba |date=22 December 2012 |title=Hot Food on a Cold Day |url=https://www.thehindu.com/features/magazine/hot-food-on-a-cold-day/article4221500.ece |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[The Hindu]]}}</ref> or cold.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Sanghvi |first=Vir |author-link=Vir Sanghvi |date=12 July 2020 |title=Rude Food by Vir Sanghvi: Roll Redemption |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/brunch/rude-food-by-vir-sanghvi-roll-redemption/story-WLkxCkUTD0BSDcINWNAALI.html |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[Hindustan Times]] |archive-date=24 October 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221024034732/https://www.hindustantimes.com/brunch/rude-food-by-vir-sanghvi-roll-redemption/story-WLkxCkUTD0BSDcINWNAALI.html |url-status=live }}</ref>


Many variations of the Bombay sandwich exist,<ref name="Vijayakar" /> with street vendors modifying the basic ingredients of the sandwich.<ref name="Nath" /> The Bombay masala sandwich uses the spiced mashed potatoes used in [[masala dosa]].<ref name="Vijayakar" /> A version of the sandwich uses [[paneer]], while another uses potatoes and peas.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Francis |first=Ali |date=27 September 2021 |title=You Haven’t Had a Toasted Sandwich Until You’ve Had a Jaffle |url=https://www.bonappetit.com/story/jaffle-maker |access-date=26 January 2026 |work=[[Bon Appétit]] |archive-date=2 February 2026 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20260202040905/https://www.bonappetit.com/story/jaffle-maker |url-status=live }}</ref> Upscale versions of the Bombay sandwiches use ingredients such as imported cheese, [[sliced meat]], [[avocado]], or [[Schezwan chutney]], while sweet versions use chocolate or [[Nutella]].<ref name="Nath" /><ref name ="Ramadurai" /> California-based chef [[Preeti Mistry]] has served a version made with [[Yukon gold potato]]es, [[Chiogga beet]]s, [[pickled onions]], and [[Monterey Jack]] cheese.<ref>{{Cite book |last=Duruz |first=Jean |chapter=Geographies of Fusion |date=2019-02-25 |title=Routledge Handbook of Food in Asia |pages=13–28 |editor-last=Leong-Salobir |editor-first=Cecilia |edition=1st |publisher=[[Routledge]] |doi=10.4324/9781315617916-2 |isbn=978-1-315-61791-6}}</ref>{{rp|15, 20}} Chef [[Meera Sodha]] adapted the Bombay sandwich into a recipe called Bombay rolls, replacing the bread with [[puff pastry]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Vaculin |first=Kendra |date=7 December 2020 |title=I'm Leaving Everything From 2020 Behind Except Meera Sodha's Bombay Rolls |url=https://www.epicurious.com/recipes-menus/meera-sodhas-bombay-rolls-best-2020-recipe-article |access-date=27 January 2026 |work=[[Epicurious]] |archive-date=24 August 2025 [[Aklan]] is synonymous with ''[[inubarang manok]]'', chicken cooked with ''ubad'' (banana [[pith]]), as well as ''[[Binakol|binakol na manok]]'', chicken cooked in [[coconut water]] with lemongrass. Of particular interest is ''[[tamilok]]'' ([[shipworm]]), which is either eaten raw or dipped in an acidic sauce such as vinegar or calamansi.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/373927/newstv/biyahenidrew/adventurous-in-aklan-a-biyahe-ni-drew-itinerary|title=Adventurous in Aklan: A 'Biyahe ni Drew' itinerary|work=GMA News Online|date=August 8, 2014 |access-date=April 7, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://balita.ph/2014/06/25/tamilok-shipworm-now-a-tourism-lure-in-aklan/|title="Tamilok" (shipworm) now a tourism lure in Aklan|work=balita.ph – Online Filipino News|access-date=April 7, 2016|archive-date=April 23, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423120951/http://balita.ph/2014/06/25/tamilok-shipworm-now-a-tourism-lure-in-aklan/|url-status=dead}}</ref> There is a special prevalence of chicken and coconut milk (''gata'') in Akeanon cooking.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.admu.edu.ph/ls/soss/news/features/ateneo-students-go-food-tripping-kalibo|title=Ateneo Students Go Food Tripping in Kalibo|work=Ateneo de Manila University|access-date=April 7, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150627033152/http://admu.edu.ph/ls/soss/news/features/ateneo-students-go-food-tripping-kalibo|archive-date=June 27, 2015|url-status=dead}}</ref>

[[File:Batchoy (Philippines).jpg|thumb|[[Batchoy]], or "La Paz Batchoy", a Filipino noodle dish native to [[La Paz, Iloilo City|La Paz district]] in Iloilo]]
[[File:Ted’s Oldtimer La Paz Batchoy.jpg |thumb|[[Batchoy]], or "La Paz Batchoy", a Filipino noodle dish native to [[La Paz, Iloilo City|La Paz district]] in Iloilo]]


[[Iloilo]] is home of the ''[[batchoy]]'', derived from "ba-chui" meaning pieces of meat in Hokkien Chinese. The authentic ''batchoy'' contains fresh egg noodles called ''miki'', ''buto-buto'' broth slow-cooked for hours, and beef, pork and ''[[bulalo]]'' mixed with the local ''[[guinamos]]'' (shrimp paste). Toppings include generous amounts of fried garlic, crushed chicharon, scallions, slices of pork intestines and liver.<ref>{{cite web|last=Diaz|first=Anton|title=Ilo-ilo Food Trip|url=http://www.ourawesomeplanet.com/awesome/2013/01/iloilo-food-trip-where-are-the-best-places-to-eat-in-iloilo.html|work=Our Awesome Planet|date=January 25, 2013|access-date=June 27, 2013}}</ref> Another type of [[pancit]] which is found in the said province is ''[[pancit Molo]]'', an adaptation of wonton soup and is a specialty of the town of [[Molo, Iloilo City|Molo]], a well-known district in Iloilo. Unlike other pancit, ''pancit Molo'' is not dry but soupy and it does not make use of long, thin noodles but instead wonton wrappers made from rice flour.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.choosephilippines.com/eat/recipes/464/pancit-molo-soup/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130728024917/http://www.choosephilippines.com/eat/recipes/464/pancit-molo-soup/|url-status=usurped|archive-date=July 28, 2013|title=A Big Warm Bowl of Flavorful Molo|author=ABS-CBN Corp.|work=Choose Philippines|access-date=April 7, 2016}}</ref> Iloilo is also famous for its two ''[[Cajanus cajan|kadios]]'' or pigeon pea-based soups. The first is KBL or ''[[Kadyos, baboy, kag langka|kadios baboy langka]]''. As the name implies, the three main ingredients of this dish are ''kadyos'', ''baboy'' (pork), and ''langka'' (unripe jackfruit is used here).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pinoyrecipe.net/kadyos-baboy-langka-recipe/|title=Kadyo Baboy Langka Recipe|access-date=April 7, 2016}}</ref> Another one is KMU or ''[[Kadyos, manok, kag ubad|kadios manok ubad]]''. This dish is composed mainly of ''kadyos'', ''manok'' (preferably free range chicken called ''Bisaya nga manok'' in Iloilo), and ''ubad'' (thinly cut white core of the banana stalk/trunk). Both of these dishes utilize another Ilonggo ingredient as a souring agent. This ingredient is ''batwan'',<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pinoyrecipe.net/top-6-health-benefits-of-batuan-batwan-fruit-and-filipino-recipes-you-can-cook-with/|title=Top 6 Health Benefits of Batwan Fruit|access-date=December 18, 2017}}</ref> or ''Garcinia binucao'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.experiencenegros.com/batuan-fruit-is-the-best/|title=Batuan Fruit is the Best|date=December 14, 2017 |access-date=December 16, 2017}}</ref> a fruit closely related to mangosteen, which is very popular in [[Western Visayas]] and neighbouring [[Negros Island]], but is generally unknown to other parts of the Philippines.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bar.gov.ph/index.php/test-archive/42-september-2012-issue/1354-binucao-the-underutilized-souring-agent|title=Bureau of Agricultural Research Chronicle}}{{Dead link|date=August 2025 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>

← Previous revision Revision as of 22:04, 9 February 2026
Line 36: Line 36:


==="The Vegetarian"===
==="The Vegetarian"===
Mr. Cheong considers his wife to be "completely unremarkable in any way". He explains that when he first met her, he was not even attracted to her and that suited him just fine. Mr. Cheong is content with meandering through life; it seems as if his only goal is to live a conventional, unremarkable life. He chooses to marry his wife since he thinks she would prove to be a good, dutiful wife who would fit nicely into the kind of lifestyle he seeks. After several years of relatively normal marriage, Mr. Cheong wakes up to find his wife disposing of all meat products in the house. He demands an explanation, and Yeong-hye replies vaguely that "I had a dream." Mr. Cheong attempts to rationalize his wife's life decision over the next few months and to deal with vegetarian meals at home, but as Yeong-hye gradually starts to eat less and continues to get thinner, he eventually calls Yeong-hye's family and an intervention is scheduled. In the meantime, his wife's unwillingness to have sex with him leads to him raping her repeatedly. While around the dinner table, Yeong-hye's family attempts to convince her to eat meat; her father, who served in Vietnam and is known for his stern temperament, slaps her when she refuses. Her father then asks a reluctant Mr. Cheong and Yeong-hye's brother Yeong-ho to hold her arms while he force-feeds her a piece of pork. Yeong-hye breaks away, spits out the pork, grabs a fruit knife, and slits her wrist. The incredulous family rushes her to a hospital where she recovers and where Mr. Cheong admits to himself that she has become mentally unstable. At the hospital Yeong-hye's mother makes her drink non-vegetarian drink by saying that it is made out of vegetables. When she realizes the truth, she vomits all of what she have drank and eaten. As the section ends Yeong-hye manages to walk out of the hospital and when she is tracked down, she reveals a bird in her palm, which has a "predator's bite" in it, and she asks "Have I done something wrong?"
Mr. Cheong considers his wife to be "completely unremarkable in any way". He explains that when he first met her, he was not even attracted to her and that suited him just fine. Mr. Cheong is content with meandering through life; it seems as if his only goal is to live a conventional, unremarkable life. He chooses to marry his wife since he thinks she would prove to be a good, dutiful wife who would fit nicely into the kind of lifestyle he seeks. After several years of relatively normal marriage, Mr. Cheong wakes up to find his wife disposing of all meat products in the house. He demands an explanation, and Yeong-hye replies vaguely that "I had a dream." Mr. Cheong attempts to rationalize his wife's life decision over the next few months and to deal with vegetarian meals at home, but as Yeong-hye gradually starts to eat less and continues to get thinner, he eventually calls Yeong-hye's family and an intervention is scheduled. Because of his smell as meat, Yeong-hye refuses to have sexual relationships with him. Despite of her refusal, he rapes her repeatedly. While around the dinner table, Yeong-hye's family attempts to convince her to eat meat; her father, who served in Vietnam and is known for his stern temperament, slaps her when she refuses. Her father then asks a reluctant Mr. Cheong and Yeong-hye's brother Yeong-ho to hold her arms while he force-feeds her a piece of pork. Yeong-hye breaks away, spits out the pork, grabs a fruit knife, and slits her wrist. The incredulous family rushes her to a hospital where she recovers and where Mr. Cheong admits to himself that she has become mentally unstable. At the hospital Yeong-hye's mother makes her drink non-vegetarian drink by saying that it is made out of vegetables. When she realizes the truth, she vomits all of what she have drank and eaten. As the section ends Yeong-hye manages to walk out of the hospital and when she is tracked down, she reveals a bird in her palm, which has a "predator's bite" in it, and she asks "Have I done something wrong?"

==History==
==Background==
(SPLIT BOTH INTO MANIFESTATIONS OF THE ACTION & RESPONSE BY REGULATORS)
(SPLIT BOTH INTO MANIFESTATIONS OF THE ACTION & RESPONSE BY REGULATORS)
In December 2025, ''[[Bloomberg News|Bloomberg]]'' reported that X users found Grok would comply with unconsensual requests to digitally undress individuals, including [[Minor (law)|minor]]s, or show them performing sexually explicit acts. The majority of these prompts were targeted at women and girls.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Solon |first1=Olivia |last2=Bergen |first2=Mark |title=Grok Makes Sexual Images of Kids as Users Test AI Guardrails |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2026-01-02/grok-posts-sexual-images-of-minors-after-lapses-in-safeguards |website=Bloomberg |access-date=2 January 2026}}</ref> An analysis of 20,000 images generated by Grok between December 25, 2025 and January 1, 2026 showed 2% were of people in bikinis or transparent clothes and appeared to be 18 or younger, including 30 of "young or very young" women or girls.<ref name="o288">{{cite web | last=Chan | first=Kelvin | title=Musk's AI chatbot faces global backlash over sexualized images of women and children | website=AP News | date=2026-01-06 | url=https://apnews.com/article/grok-x-musk-ai-nudification-abuse-2021bbdb508d080d46e3ae7b8f297d36 | access-date=2026-01-07}}</ref> A separate analysis conducted over 24 hours from January 5 to 6 calculated that users had Grok create 6,700 sexually suggestive or nudified images per hour.<ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2026-01-07/musk-s-grok-ai-generated-thousands-of-undressed-images-per-hour-on-x | title=Musk's Grok AI Generated Thousands of Undressed Images Per Hour on X | first=Cecilia | last=D'Anastasio | publisher=Bloomberg | date=2026-01-07}}</ref><ref name="guard-8jan2026">{{cite news |last1=Wilson |first1=Jason |title=Hundreds of nonconsensual AI images being created by Grok on X, data shows |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2026/jan/08/grok-x-nonconsensual-images |access-date=January 8, 2026 |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=January 8, 2026}}</ref> xAI responded to requests for comment from media organizations with the automated reply, "Legacy Media Lies."<ref>{{Cite news |last=Venugopal |first=Sahana |date=2025-12-31 |title=X's Grok used to undress Bollywood actors, female social media users through photos |url=https://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/technology/xs-grok-used-to-undress-bollywood-actors-female-social-media-users-through-photos/article70455947.ece |access-date=2026-01-01 |work=The Hindu |language=en-IN |issn=0971-751X}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Robins-Early |first=Nick |date=2026-01-02 |title=Elon Musk's Grok AI generates images of 'minors in minimal clothing' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2026/jan/02/elon-musk-grok-ai-children-photos |access-date=2026-01-02 |work=The Guardian |language=en-GB |issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web On February 3, [[Labour Party (Ireland)|Labour Party]] [[Teachta Dála|TD]] [[Alan Kelly (politician)|Alan Kelly]] described as "disgraceful" the refusal of X to attend a media committee on the regulation of online platforms, despite the committee writing to them.<ref name=rte-french-cybercrime-authorities-search-x-offices/> He also described the controversy about Grok as "shameful" and "shocking".<ref name=rte-french-cybercrime-authorities-search-x-offices/> Regarding the committee meeting, scheduled for February 4, Kelly said "Meta have agreed to come in. Google have agreed to come in. TikTok have agreed to come in.".<ref name=rte-french-cybercrime-authorities-search-x-offices/>

In a February 2025 interview with TVX, Umaña described Cambio Total as "a party of war, not electoral" ("{{lang|es|un partido de guerra, no electorero}}").<ref>{{cite web|url=https://diariolahuella.com/nuevo-partido-cambio-total-ha-preocupado-al-gobierno-de-nuevas-ideas-asegura-ronal-umana/|title=Nuevo Partido "Cambio Total" ha Preocupado al Gobierno de Nuevas Ideas, Asegura Ronal Umaña|trans-title=New Party "Total Change" Has Nuevas Ideas' Government Preoccupied, Assures Ronal Umaña|language=es|date=25 February 2025|access-date=10 July 2025|work=Diario la Huella|first1=Edgar|last1=Torres}}</ref> In July 2025, stated that the party aimed to consolidate El Salvador's political opposition ahead of the [[2027 Salvadoran presidential election|next presidential election]] and indicated that some members of the [[Nationalist Republican Alliance]] (ARENA) and [[Farabundo Martí National Liberation Front]] (FMLN) supported Cambio Total.<ref name="DE">{{cite web|url=https://diarioelsalvador.com/umana-publica-logo-de-partido-politico-en-formacion/673367/|title=Dirigente de la Oposición, Ronal Umaña, Publica Logo de Partido Político en Formación|trans-title=Opposition Leader, Ronal Umaña, Publishes Logo of a Political Party in Formation|language=es|date=10 July 2025|access-date=10 July 2025|work=Diario El Salvador|first1=Gerson|last1=Chávez}}</ref> Umaña has indicated the need to "found a new republic" ("{{lang|es|fundar una nueva república}}") after Bukele leaves office.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://lapagina.com.sv/politica/como-caos-organizado-califica-ronal-umana-avances-del-pais-en-la-gestion-del-presidente-bukele/|title=Como «Caos Organizado» Califica Ronal Umaña Avances del País en la Gestión del Presidente Bukele|trans-title=Ronald Umaña Describes the Country's Progress under President Bukele's Term as "Organized Chaos"|language=es|date=3 July 2025|access-date=10 July 2025|work=La Página}}</ref>
In a February 2025 interview with TVX, Umaña described Cambio Total as "a party of war, not electoral" ("{{lang|es|un partido de guerra, no electorero}}").<ref>{{cite web|url=https://diariolahuella.com/nuevo-partido-cambio-total-ha-preocupado-al-gobierno-de-nuevas-ideas-asegura-ronal-umana/|title=Nuevo Partido "Cambio Total" ha Preocupado al Gobierno de Nuevas Ideas, Asegura Ronal Umaña|trans-title=New Party "Total Change" Has Nuevas Ideas' Government Preoccupied, Assures Ronal Umaña|language=es|date=25 February 2025|access-date=10 July 2025|work=Diario la Huella|first1=Edgar|last1=Torres}}</ref> In July 2025, stated that the party aimed to consolidate El Salvador's political opposition ahead of the [[2027 Salvadoran presidential election|next presidential election]] and indicated that some members of the [[Nationalist Republican Alliance]] (ARENA) and [[Farabundo Martí National Liberation Front]] (FMLN) supported Cambio Total.<ref name="DE">{{cite web|url=https://diarioelsalvador.com/umana-publica-logo-de-partido-politico-en-formacion/673367/|title=Dirigente de la Oposición, Ronal Umaña, Publica Logo de Partido Político en Formación|trans-title=Opposition Leader, Ronal Umaña, Publishes Logo of a Political Party in Formation|language=es|date=10 July 2025|access-date=10 July 2025|work=Diario El Salvador|first1=Gerson|last1=Chávez}}</ref> Umaña has indicated the need to "found a new republic" ("{{lang|es|fundar una nueva república}}") after Bukele leaves office.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://lapagina.com.sv/politica/como-caos-organizado-califica-ronal-umana-avances-del-pais-en-la-gestion-del-presidente-bukele/|title=Como «Caos Organizado» Califica Ronal Umaña Avances del País en la Gestión del Presidente Bukele|trans-title=Ronald Umaña Describes the Country's Progress under President Bukele's Term as "Organized Chaos"|language=es|date=3 July 2025|access-date=10 July 2025|work=La Página}}</ref>


On 9 July 2025, Umaña made a post on [[Twitter|X]] revealing the party's logo consisting of a yellow sun on a green background.<ref name="DE" /> In August 2025, Umaña suggested nominating ''[[La Prensa Gráfica]]'' contributor José Miguel Fortín Magaña and economy Evelyn Martínez as Cambio Total's presidential and vice presidential candidates, respectively, for the [[2027 Salvadoran presidential election|2027 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://lanoticiasv.com/umana-critica-a-arena-por-decidir-participar-en-las-elecciones-de-2027-jamas-van-a-ganar-nada/|title=Umaña Critica a ARENA por Decidir Participar en las Elecciones de 2027: "Jamás Van a Ganar Nada"|trans-title=Umaña Criticizes ARENA for Deciding to Participate in the 2027 Elections: "They Won't Win Anything"|language=es|date=14 August 2025|access-date=30 August 2025|work=La Noticia SV|first1=David|last1=Morales}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://lanoticiasv.com/remberto-gonzalez-analiza-precandidaturas-presidenciales-se-requiere-mucho-dinero-y-mucho-talento-politico/|title=Remberto González Analiza Precandidaturas Presidenciales: "Se Requiere Mucho Dinero y Mucho Talento Político"|trans-title=Remberto González Analyses Presidential Pre-Candidacies: "It Requires A Lot of Money and A Lot of Political Talent"|language=es|date=29 August 2025|access-date=30 August 2025|work=La Noticia SV|first1=Verónica|last1=Martínez}}</ref>

'''Cadillac Motor Car Division''', or simply '''Cadillac''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|k|æ|d|ᵻ|l|æ|k}}), is the [[luxury vehicle]] [[division (business)|division]] of the American automobile manufacturer [[General Motors]] (GM). Its major markets are the United States, Canada, and China; Cadillac models are also distributed in 34 additional markets worldwide. Historically, Cadillac automobiles were at the top of the luxury field within the United States, but have been outsold by European luxury brands including [[BMW]] and [[Mercedes-Benz|Mercedes]] since the 2000s.<ref>{{cite news |author=Keith Bradsher |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2000/01/13/business/luxury-wheel-turns-to-europe-on-us-premium-car-sales-the-continent-sets-the-pace.html |title=Luxury Wheel Turns to Europe; On U.S. Premium Car Sales, the Continent Sets the Pace |newspaper=The New York Times |date=January 13, 2000 |access-date=August 1, 2023 |quote=European-brand luxury cars as a group managed for the first time last year to accomplish what once seemed impossible: beating American luxury brands in sales in their home market}}</ref> In 2019, Cadillac sold 390,458 vehicles worldwide, a record for the brand.<ref>{{cite press release |url=https://media.gm.com/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/emergency_news/2020/0205-earnings.html |title=GM Reports Earnings and Provides 2020 Outlook |publisher=General Motors |date=February 5, 2020 |access-date=February 5, 2020}}</ref>
'''Cadillac Motor Car Division''', or simply '''Cadillac''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|k|æ|d|ᵻ|l|æ|k}}), is the [[luxury vehicle]] [[division (business)|division]] of the American automobile manufacturer [[General Motors]] (GM). Its major markets are the United States, Canada, and China; Cadillac models are also distributed in 34 additional markets worldwide. Historically, Cadillac automobiles were at the top of the luxury field within the United States, often competing with [[Lincoln Motor Company|Lincoln]], but have been outsold by European luxury brands including [[BMW]] and [[Mercedes-Benz|Mercedes]] since the 2000s.<ref>{{cite news |author=Keith Bradsher |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2000/01/13/business/luxury-wheel-turns-to-europe-on-us-premium-car-sales-the-continent-sets-the-pace.html |title=Luxury Wheel Turns to Europe; On U.S. Premium Car Sales, the Continent Sets the Pace |newspaper=The New York Times |date=January 13, 2000 |access-date=August 1, 2023 |quote=European-brand luxury cars as a group managed for the first time last year to accomplish what once seemed impossible: beating American luxury brands in sales in their home market}}</ref> In 2019, Cadillac sold 390,458 vehicles worldwide, a record for the brand.<ref>{{cite press release |url=https://media.gm.com/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/emergency_news/2020/0205-earnings.html |title=GM Reports Earnings and Provides 2020 Outlook |publisher=General Motors |date=February 5, 2020 |access-date=February 5, 2020}}</ref>


Cadillac, founded in 1902, is among the first automotive brands in the world, fourth in the United States only to [[Autocar Company]] (1897) and fellow GM marques [[Oldsmobile]] (1897) and [[Buick]] (1899). It was named after [[Antoine de la Mothe Cadillac]] (1658–1730), the French explorer who founded [[Detroit]], Michigan. The Cadillac crest is based on his [[coat of arms]].

It was named after [[Antoine de la Mothe Cadillac]] (1658–1730), the French explorer who founded [[Detroit]], Michigan. The Cadillac crest is based on his [[coat of arms]].

== Critical reception ==
== Critical reception ==
Jon Caramanica writing for ''[[The New York Times]]'' felt the song was "spacious and ethereal but not directionless—it is R&B that privileges mood over structure, soft daubs of feeling over authoritative belting."<ref>{{Cite news |last=Caramanica |first=Jon |date=2022-07-20 |title=R&B That Sweats, Emotionally and Physically |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/07/20/arts/music/brent-faiyaz-muni-long.html |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220720180128/https://www.nytimes.com/2022/07/20/arts/music/brent-faiyaz-muni-long.html |archive-date=July 20, 2022 |access-date=2026-02-09 |work=[[The New York Times]] |language=en-US |issn=0362-4331}}</ref> While ''Clash''<nowiki/>'s Robin Murray wrote the song "find[s] Brent daring to pull down the curtain of hype that surrounds him, and let fans see a little extra from his world."<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Murray |first=Robin |date=July 8, 2022 |title=Brent Faiyaz – ''Wasteland'' |url=https://www.clashmusic.com/reviews/brent-faiyaz-wasteland/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240222135322/https://www.clashmusic.com/reviews/brent-faiyaz-wasteland/ |archive-date=February 22, 2024 |access-date=October 6, 2024 |magazine=[[Clash (magazine)|Clash]] |language=en-US}}</ref>
Jon Caramanica writing for ''[[The New York Times]]'' felt the song was "spacious and ethereal but not directionless—it is R&B that privileges mood over structure, soft daubs of feeling over authoritative belting."<ref>{{Cite news |last=Caramanica |first=Jon |date=2022-07-20 |title=R&B That Sweats, Emotionally and Physically |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/07/20/arts/music/brent-faiyaz-muni-long.html |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220720180128/https://www.nytimes.com/2022/07/20/arts/music/brent-faiyaz-muni-long.html |archive-date=July 20, 2022 |access-date=2026-02-09 |work=[[The New York Times]] |language=en-US |issn=0362-4331}}</ref> While ''Clash''<nowiki/>'s Robin Murray wrote the song "find[s] Brent daring to pull down the curtain of hype that surrounds him, and let fans see a little extra from his world."<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Murray |first=Robin |date=July 8, 2022 |title=Brent Faiyaz – ''Wasteland'' |url=https://www.clashmusic.com/reviews/brent-faiyaz-wasteland/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240222135322/https://www.clashmusic.com/reviews/brent-faiyaz-wasteland/ |archive-date=February 22, 2024 |access-date=October 6, 2024 |magazine=[[Clash (magazine)|Clash]] |language=en-US}}</ref> Jem Aswad of ''Variety'' said the song was "infectious".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Aswad |first=Jem |date=2023-05-02 |title=Brent Faiyaz Unveils 2023 Tour Dates and Video, Strikes Partnership With UnitedMasters |url=https://variety.com/2023/music/news/brent-faiyaz-2023-tour-dates-unitedmasters-1235600958/ |access-date=2026-02-09 |website=Variety |language=en-US}}</ref>

source_payload.html:
Trial and incarceration

← Previous revision Revision as of 22:04, 9 February 2026
Line 276: Line 276:
Tyson was convicted of the rape charge on February 10, 1992, after the jury [[Deliberation|deliberated]] for nearly 10 hours.<ref>{{cite web |last=Muscatine |first=Alison |date=February 11, 1992 |title=Tyson Found Guilty of Rape, Two Other Charges |url=http://tech.mit.edu/V112/N4/tyson.04w.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100505214638/http://tech.mit.edu/V112/N4/tyson.04w.html |archive-date=May 5, 2010 |access-date=March 11, 2007 |via=MIT-The Tech |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]]}}</ref>
Tyson was convicted of the rape charge on February 10, 1992, after the jury [[Deliberation|deliberated]] for nearly 10 hours.<ref>{{cite web |last=Muscatine |first=Alison |date=February 11, 1992 |title=Tyson Found Guilty of Rape, Two Other Charges |url=http://tech.mit.edu/V112/N4/tyson.04w.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100505214638/http://tech.mit.edu/V112/N4/tyson.04w.html |archive-date=May 5, 2010 |access-date=March 11, 2007 |via=MIT-The Tech |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]]}}</ref>


[[Alan Dershowitz]], acting as Tyson's counsel, filed an appeal urging error of law in the Court's exclusion of evidence of the victim's past sexual conduct (known as the [[Rape Shield Law]]; Dershowitz alleged that Washington had "falsely accused one of her high school classmates of rape"),<ref>{{cite news |author=<!--not stated--> |date=27 February 1993 |title=New Motions in Tyson Case |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1993/02/27/sports/new-motions-in-tyson-case.html |access-date=13 August 2024 |work=The New York Times}}</ref> the exclusion of three potential defense witnesses, and the lack of [[jury instructions]] on honest and reasonable [[mistake of fact]].<ref name="Tyson v. State 1993">{{cite web |title=Tyson v. State — Leagle.com |url=http://www.leagle.com/decision/1993895619NE2d276_1891.xml/TYSON%20v.%20STATE |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402141908/http://www.leagle.com/decision/1993895619NE2d276_1891.xml/TYSON%20v.%20STATE |archive-date=April 2, 2015 |access-date=January 27, 2015 |publisher=leagle.com}}</ref> The [[Indiana Court of Appeals]] ruled against Tyson in a 2–1 vote.<ref name="Tyson v. State 1993" /> The [[Indiana Supreme Court]] let the lower court opinion stand due to a 2–2 split in its review. The tie vote was due to the fact that the Chief Justice, [[Randall T. Shepard]], recused himself from the case. The Chief Justice later revealed he did so because of a heated argument between his wife and Dershowitz at a Yale Law School reunion concerning the case.<ref>{{cite web |title=Tyson v. State |work=Justia Law |url=https://law.justia.com/cases/indiana/supreme-court/1993/49a02-9203-cr-129-4.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200611183500/https://law.justia.com/cases/indiana/supreme-court/1993/49a02-9203-cr-129-4.html |archive-date=June 11, 2020 |access-date=June 11, 2020}}</ref> On March 26, 1992, Tyson was sentenced to six years in prison along with four years of probation.<ref>{{cite news |last=Shipp |first=E. R. |date=March 27, 1992 |title=Tyson Gets 6-Year Prison Term For Rape Conviction in Indiana |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/03/27/sports/tyson-gets-6-year-prison-term-for-rape-conviction-in-indiana.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100420094909/http://www.nytimes.com/1992/03/27/sports/tyson-gets-6-year-prison-term-for-rape-conviction-in-indiana.html |archive-date=April 20, 2010 |access-date=May 12, 2010 |work=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> He was assigned to the Indiana Youth Center (now the [[Plainfield Correctional Facility]]) in April 1992,<ref>{{cite news |date=April 16, 1992 |title=Mike Tyson Assigned To Indiana Youth Center |url=https://www.orlandosentinel.com/1992/04/16/mike-tyson-assigned-to-indiana-youth-center/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111020104655/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1992-04-16/news/9204160536_1_mike-tyson-youth-center-indiana-youth |archive-date=October 20, 2011 |access-date=August 27, 2010 |newspaper=[[Orlando Sentinel]]}}</ref> and he was released in March 1995 after serving less than three years of the sentence.<ref>{{cite news |last=Berkow, Ira |first=Ira |date=March 26, 1995 |title=After Three Years in Prison, Tyson Gains His Freedom |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1995/03/26/sports/boxing-after-three-years-in-prison-tyson-gains-his-freedom.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170828062658/http://www.nytimes.com/1995/03/26/sports/boxing-after-three-years-in-prison-tyson-gains-his-freedom.html |archive-date=August 28, 2017 |access-date=February 11, 2017 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> [[Mike Tyson's prison tattoos|He left with prison tattoos]] of tennis player [[Arthur Ashe]] and Chinese communist leader [[Mao Zedong]]; Tyson also dates his tattoo of Marxist revolutionary [[Che Guevara]] to this time<!-- Actual timing ambiguous; see [[Mike Tyson's tattoos]]. -->.<ref>{{cite book |last1=Hoffer |first1=Richard |author1-link=Richard Hoffer |title=A Savage Business: The Comeback and Comedown of Mike Tyson |date=1998 |publisher=[[Simon & Schuster]] |isbn=9780684809083 |location=New York City |pages=[https://archive.org/details/savagebusinessco00hoff/page/36 36], [https://archive.org/details/savagebusinessco00hoff/page/266 266] |ol=689533M}}</ref><ref>{{cite AV media |title=[[Tyson (2008 film)|Tyson]] |date=2008 |last=Toback |first=James |author-mask=[[Toback, James]] (director) |type=Documentary film |language=en |publisher=[[Sony Classics]] |time=58:51}}</ref>
[[Alan Dershowitz]], acting as Tyson's counsel, filed an appeal urging error of law in the Court's exclusion of evidence of the victim's past sexual conduct (known as the [[Rape Shield Law]]; Dershowitz alleged that Washington had "falsely accused one of her high school classmates of rape"),<ref>{{cite news |author=<!--not stated--> |date=27 February 1993 |title=New Motions in Tyson Case |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1993/02/27/sports/new-motions-in-tyson-case.html |access-date=13 August 2024 |work=The New York Times}}</ref> the exclusion of three potential defense witnesses, and the lack of [[jury instructions]] on honest and reasonable [[mistake of fact]].<ref name="Tyson v. State 1993">{{cite web |title=Tyson v. State — Leagle.com |url=http://www.leagle.com/decision/1993895619NE2d276_1891.xml/TYSON%20v.%20STATE |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402141908/http://www.leagle.com/decision/1993895619NE2d276_1891.xml/TYSON%20v.%20STATE |archive-date=April 2, 2015 |access-date=January 27, 2015 |publisher=leagle.com}}</ref> The [[Indiana Court of Appeals]] ruled against Tyson in a 2–1 vote.<ref name="Tyson v. State 1993" /> The [[Indiana Supreme Court]] let the lower court opinion stand due to a 2–2 split in its review. The tie vote was due to the fact that the Chief Justice, [[Randall T. Shepard]], recused himself from the case. Shepard later revealed that he did so because of a heated argument between his wife and Dershowitz at a Yale Law School reunion concerning the case.<ref>{{cite web |title=Tyson v. State |work=Justia Law |url=https://law.justia.com/cases/indiana/supreme-court/1993/49a02-9203-cr-129-4.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200611183500/https://law.justia.com/cases/indiana/supreme-court/1993/49a02-9203-cr-129-4.html |archive-date=June 11, 2020 |access-date=June 11, 2020}}</ref> On March 26, 1992, Tyson was sentenced to six years in prison along with four years of probation.<ref>{{cite news |last=Shipp |first=E. R. |date=March 27, 1992 |title=Tyson Gets 6-Year Prison Term For Rape Conviction in Indiana |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/03/27/sports/tyson-gets-6-year-prison-term-for-rape-conviction-in-indiana.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100420094909/http://www.nytimes.com/1992/03/27/sports/tyson-gets-6-year-prison-term-for-rape-conviction-in-indiana.html |archive-date=April 20, 2010 |access-date=May 12, 2010 |work=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> He was assigned to the Indiana Youth Center (now the [[Plainfield Correctional Facility]]) in April 1992,<ref>{{cite news |date=April 16, 1992 |title=Mike Tyson Assigned To Indiana Youth Center |url=https://www.orlandosentinel.com/1992/04/16/mike-tyson-assigned-to-indiana-youth-center/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111020104655/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1992-04-16/news/9204160536_1_mike-tyson-youth-center-indiana-youth |archive-date=October 20, 2011 |access-date=August 27, 2010 |newspaper=[[Orlando Sentinel]]}}</ref> and he was released in March 1995 after serving less than three years of the sentence.<ref>{{cite news |last=Berkow, Ira |first=Ira |date=March 26, 1995 |title=After Three Years in Prison, Tyson Gains His Freedom |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1995/03/26/sports/boxing-after-three-years-in-prison-tyson-gains-his-freedom.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170828062658/http://www.nytimes.com/1995/03/26/sports/boxing-after-three-years-in-prison-tyson-gains-his-freedom.html |archive-date=August 28, 2017 |access-date=February 11, 2017 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> [[Mike Tyson's prison tattoos|He left with prison tattoos]] of tennis player [[Arthur Ashe]] and Chinese communist leader [[Mao Zedong]]; Tyson also dates his tattoo of Marxist revolutionary [[Che Guevara]] to this time<!-- Actual timing ambiguous; see [[Mike Tyson's tattoos]]. -->.<ref>{{cite book |last1=Hoffer |first1=Richard |author1-link=Richard Hoffer |title=A Savage Business: The Comeback and Comedown of Mike Tyson |date=1998 |publisher=[[Simon & Schuster]] |isbn=9780684809083 |location=New York City |pages=[https://archive.org/details/savagebusinessco00hoff/page/36 36], [https://archive.org/details/savagebusinessco00hoff/page/266 266] |ol=689533M}}</ref><ref>{{cite AV media |title=[[Tyson (2008 film)|Tyson]] |date=2008 |last=Toback |first=James |author-mask=[[Toback, James]] (director) |type=Documentary film |language=en |publisher=[[Sony Classics]] |time=58:51}}</ref>


Due to his conviction, Tyson was required to [[sex offender registries in the United States|register]] as a Tier II [[sex offender]] under [[Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act|federal law]].<ref>{{cite news |date=April 3, 2002 |title=Tyson to register as sex offender |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/1389708/Tyson-to-register-as-sex-offender.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180817023238/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/1389708/Tyson-to-register-as-sex-offender.html |archive-date=August 17, 2018 |access-date=April 4, 2018 |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |location=London, England}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |date=November 19, 2007 |title=Mike Tyson receives 1 day in jail, 3 years probation |url=http://www.azcentral.com/news/articles/1119mr-tyson1119-onUpdate.html |access-date=October 6, 2015 |work=[[The Arizona Republic]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Friess |first1=Steve |date=April 17, 2015 |title=One Survivor's Crusade Reveals a Plague of Errors in Nation's Sex Offender Registries |url=http://www.takepart.com/feature/2015/04/17/errors-sexual-offender-registries |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151007095015/http://www.takepart.com/feature/2015/04/17/errors-sexual-offender-registries |archive-date=October 7, 2015 |access-date=October 6, 2015 |website=TakePart}}</ref> Tyson has continued to maintain his innocence. In 1992, Erinn Cosby, the daughter of comedian and actor [[Bill Cosby]], publicly accused Tyson of sexually assaulting her in 1989, although no criminal charges were ever sought.<ref>{{cite news |last=Roig-Franzia |first=Manuel |date=6 July 2016 |title=The forgotten story of when Bill Cosby's daughter accused Mike Tyson of rape |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/the-forgotten-story-of-when-bill-cosbys-daughter-accused-mike-tyson-of-rape/2016/07/06/bebc0afe-42c4-11e6-88d0-6adee48be8bc_story.html |access-date=13 August 2024 |newspaper=The Washington Post}}</ref>
Due to his conviction, Tyson was required to [[sex offender registries in the United States|register]] as a Tier II [[sex offender]] under [[Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act|federal law]].<ref>{{cite news |date=April 3, 2002 |title=Tyson to register as sex offender |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/1389708/Tyson-to-register-as-sex-offender.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180817023238/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/1389708/Tyson-to-register-as-sex-offender.html |archive-date=August 17, 2018 |access-date=April 4, 2018 |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |location=London, England}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |date=November 19, 2007 |title=Mike Tyson receives 1 day in jail, 3 years probation |url=http://www.azcentral.com/news/articles/1119mr-tyson1119-onUpdate.html |access-date=October 6, 2015 |work=[[The Arizona Republic]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Friess |first1=Steve |date=April 17, 2015 |title=One Survivor's Crusade Reveals a Plague of Errors in Nation's Sex Offender Registries |url=http://www.takepart.com/feature/2015/04/17/errors-sexual-offender-registries |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151007095015/http://www.takepart.com/feature/2015/04/17/errors-sexual-offender-registries |archive-date=October 7, 2015 |access-date=October 6, 2015 |website=TakePart}}</ref> Tyson has continued to maintain his innocence. In 1992, Erinn Cosby, the daughter of comedian and actor [[Bill Cosby]], publicly accused Tyson of sexually assaulting her in 1989, although no criminal charges were ever sought.<ref>{{cite news |last=Roig-Franzia |first=Manuel |date=6 July 2016 |title=The forgotten story of when Bill Cosby's daughter accused Mike Tyson of rape |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/the-forgotten-story-of-when-bill-cosbys-daughter-accused-mike-tyson-of-rape/2016/07/06/bebc0afe-42c4-11e6-88d0-6adee48be8bc_story.html |access-date=13 August 2024 |newspaper=The Washington Post}}</ref>

== Israeli military support ==
== Israeli military support ==
The Israeli military has utilized Microsoft's [[Microsoft Azure|Azure]] [[cloud computing]] platform and AI services during the [[Gaza war]] to identify targets. Since 2022, it has also used Microsoft's servers to store millions of hours of intercepted Palestinians' phone calls.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Davies |first1=Harry |last2=Abraham |first2=Yuval |title=‘A million calls an hour’: Israel relying on Microsoft cloud for expansive surveillance of Palestinians |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/aug/06/microsoft-israeli-military-palestinian-phone-calls-cloud |website=The Guardian |access-date=14 August 2025 |date=6 August 2025}}</ref> The [[Ministry of Defense (Israel)|Israeli Ministry of Defense]] is Microsoft's second largest military customer. This relationship has led to protests within the company.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Biesecker |first1=Michael |last2=Mednick |first2=Sam |last3=Burke |first3=Garance |title=As Israel uses US-made AI models in war, concerns arise about tech's role in who lives and who dies |url=https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-ai-technology-737bc17af7b03e98c29cec4e15d0f108 |website=AP News |access-date=18 April 2025 |date=18 February 2025 |archive-date=May 31, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250531173736/https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-ai-technology-737bc17af7b03e98c29cec4e15d0f108 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="Pratt0401">{{cite web |last1=Pratt |first1=Timothy |title=Microsoft faces growing unrest over role in Israel's war on Gaza: 'Close to a tipping point' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2025/apr/18/microsoft-ai-israel-gaza-war |website=The Guardian |access-date=18 April 2025 |date=18 April 2025}}</ref> In response, Microsoft employees founded the "No Azure for [[Israeli apartheid|Apartheid]]" campaign to advocate for the company to cut ties with Israel.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Essa |first1=Azad |title=Inside the campaign to end Microsoft's collaboration with the Israeli army |url=https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/inside-campaign-end-microsofts-collaboration-israeli-army |website=Middle East Eye |access-date=18 April 2025 |date=10 April 2025 |archive-date=April 22, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250422232402/https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/inside-campaign-end-microsofts-collaboration-israeli-army |url-status=live }}</ref> The group is a part of the larger [[No Tech for Apartheid]] movement.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://medium.com/@notechforapartheid/a-marriage-made-in-hell-an-introduction-to-microsofts-complicity-in-apartheid-and-genocide-d7dfad65a196|title=A Marriage Made in Hell: An Introduction to Microsoft's Complicity in Apartheid and Genocide|access-date=19 April 2025|website=Medium|date=May 21, 2024|archive-date=April 22, 2025|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250422061622/https://medium.com/@notechforapartheid/a-marriage-made-in-hell-an-introduction-to-microsofts-complicity-in-apartheid-and-genocide-d7dfad65a196|url-status=live}}</ref>
The Israeli military has utilized Microsoft's [[Microsoft Azure|Azure]] [[cloud computing]] platform and AI services during the [[Gaza war]] to identify targets. Since 2022, it has also used Microsoft's servers to store millions of hours of intercepted Palestinians' phone calls.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Davies |first1=Harry |last2=Abraham |first2=Yuval |title='A million calls an hour': Israel relying on Microsoft cloud for expansive surveillance of Palestinians |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/aug/06/microsoft-israeli-military-palestinian-phone-calls-cloud |website=The Guardian |access-date=14 August 2025 |date=6 August 2025}}</ref> The [[Ministry of Defense (Israel)|Israeli Ministry of Defense]] is Microsoft's second largest military customer. This relationship has led to protests within the company.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Biesecker |first1=Michael |last2=Mednick |first2=Sam |last3=Burke |first3=Garance |title=As Israel uses US-made AI models in war, concerns arise about tech's role in who lives and who dies |url=https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-ai-technology-737bc17af7b03e98c29cec4e15d0f108 |website=AP News |access-date=18 April 2025 |date=18 February 2025 |archive-date=May 31, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250531173736/https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-ai-technology-737bc17af7b03e98c29cec4e15d0f108 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="Pratt0401">{{cite web |last1=Pratt |first1=Timothy |title=Microsoft faces growing unrest over role in Israel's war on Gaza: 'Close to a tipping point' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2025/apr/18/microsoft-ai-israel-gaza-war |website=The Guardian |access-date=18 April 2025 |date=18 April 2025}}</ref> In response, Microsoft employees founded the "No Azure for [[Israeli apartheid|Apartheid]]" campaign to advocate for the company to cut ties with Israel.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Essa |first1=Azad |title=Inside the campaign to end Microsoft's collaboration with the Israeli army |url=https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/inside-campaign-end-microsofts-collaboration-israeli-army |website=Middle East Eye |access-date=18 April 2025 |date=10 April 2025 |archive-date=April 22, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250422232402/https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/inside-campaign-end-microsofts-collaboration-israeli-army |url-status=live }}</ref> The group is a part of the larger [[No Tech for Apartheid]] movement.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://medium.com/@notechforapartheid/a-marriage-made-in-hell-an-introduction-to-microsofts-complicity-in-apartheid-and-genocide-d7dfad65a196|title=A Marriage Made in Hell: An Introduction to Microsoft's Complicity in Apartheid and Genocide|access-date=19 April 2025|website=Medium|date=May 21, 2024|archive-date=April 22, 2025|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250422061622/https://medium.com/@notechforapartheid/a-marriage-made-in-hell-an-introduction-to-microsofts-complicity-in-apartheid-and-genocide-d7dfad65a196|url-status=live}}</ref>


In October 2024, Microsoft fired two employees who organized an unauthorized vigil at its Redmond headquarters to honor Palestinians killed in the [[Gaza war]]. The employees, part of the group "No Azure for Apartheid," sought to address the company's involvement in the Israeli government's use of its technology.<ref>{{cite news |last=O’BRIEN |first=MATT |title=Microsoft fires employees who organized vigil for Palestinians killed in Gaza |date=25 October 2024 |url=https://apnews.com/article/microsoft-fired-workers-israel-palestinians-gaza-72de6fe1f35db9398e3b6785203c6bbf |website=AP News |access-date=27 October 2024 |archive-date=April 27, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250427221645/https://apnews.com/article/microsoft-fired-workers-israel-palestinians-gaza-72de6fe1f35db9398e3b6785203c6bbf |url-status=live }}</ref>
In October 2024, Microsoft fired two employees who organized an unauthorized vigil at its Redmond headquarters to honor Palestinians killed in the [[Gaza war]]. The employees, part of the group "No Azure for Apartheid", sought to address the company's involvement in the Israeli government's use of its technology.<ref>{{cite news |last=O’BRIEN |first=MATT |title=Microsoft fires employees who organized vigil for Palestinians killed in Gaza |date=25 October 2024 |url=https://apnews.com/article/microsoft-fired-workers-israel-palestinians-gaza-72de6fe1f35db9398e3b6785203c6bbf |website=AP News |access-date=27 October 2024 |archive-date=April 27, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250427221645/https://apnews.com/article/microsoft-fired-workers-israel-palestinians-gaza-72de6fe1f35db9398e3b6785203c6bbf |url-status=live }}</ref>


During a February 2025 meeting, five employees were kicked out for wearing shirts that spelled out “Does Our Code Kill Kids, [[Satya Nadella|Satya]]?”<ref>{{cite web |last1=Biesecker |first1=Michael |title=Microsoft workers protest sale of AI and cloud services to Israeli military |url=https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-ai-technology-microsoft-gaza-lebanon-90541d4130d4900c719d34ebcd67179d |website=AP News |access-date=18 April 2025 |date=25 February 2025 |archive-date=April 6, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250406145039/https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-ai-technology-microsoft-gaza-lebanon-90541d4130d4900c719d34ebcd67179d |url-status=live }}</ref> On 20 March 2025, before an event at Seattle's Great Hall with [[Brad Smith (American lawyer)|Brad Smith]] and [[Steve Ballmer]], protestors projected "Microsoft powers [[Gaza genocide|genocide]]" on the wall. Subsequently, two employees interrupted AI executive Mustafa Suleyman at a speaking event on 4 April 2025 in protest at the company's support of Israel.<ref name="Pratt0401" /> In May 2025, an employee interrupted Satya Nadella's keynote speech.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2025/may/19/microsoft-ceo-speech-palestinian-protest|title=Microsoft employee interrupts CEO's keynote with pro-Palestinian protest|last=Bhuiyan|first=Johana|date=20 May 2025|work=[[The Guardian]]}}</ref>
During a February 2025 meeting, five employees were kicked out for wearing shirts that spelled out "Does Our Code Kill Kids, [[Satya Nadella|Satya]]?".<ref>{{cite web |last1=Biesecker |first1=Michael |title=Microsoft workers protest sale of AI and cloud services to Israeli military |url=https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-ai-technology-microsoft-gaza-lebanon-90541d4130d4900c719d34ebcd67179d |website=AP News |access-date=18 April 2025 |date=25 February 2025 |archive-date=April 6, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250406145039/https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-ai-technology-microsoft-gaza-lebanon-90541d4130d4900c719d34ebcd67179d |url-status=live }}</ref> On 20 March 2025, before an event at Seattle's Great Hall with [[Brad Smith (American lawyer)|Brad Smith]] and [[Steve Ballmer]], protestors projected "Microsoft powers [[Gaza genocide|genocide]]" on the wall. Subsequently, two employees interrupted AI executive Mustafa Suleyman at a speaking event on 4 April 2025 in protest at the company's support of Israel.<ref name="Pratt0401" /> In May 2025, an employee interrupted Satya Nadella's keynote speech.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2025/may/19/microsoft-ceo-speech-palestinian-protest|title=Microsoft employee interrupts CEO's keynote with pro-Palestinian protest|last=Bhuiyan|first=Johana|date=20 May 2025|work=[[The Guardian]]}}</ref>


In April 2025, the [[Boycott, Divestment and Sanctions]] movement added Microsoft to its list of targets for partnering "with the apartheid regime of Israel and its prison system".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.polygon.com/news/554879/bds-palestine-israel-xbox-microsoft-boycott-candy-crush-minecraft-call-of-duty|title=Palestinian-led BDS movement adds Microsoft's Xbox as priority boycott target|date=8 April 2025|access-date=18 April 2025|website=Polygon|last=Walker|first=Ian}}</ref>
In April 2025, the [[Boycott, Divestment and Sanctions]] movement added Microsoft to its list of targets for partnering "with the apartheid regime of Israel and its prison system".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.polygon.com/news/554879/bds-palestine-israel-xbox-microsoft-boycott-candy-crush-minecraft-call-of-duty|title=Palestinian-led BDS movement adds Microsoft's Xbox as priority boycott target|date=8 April 2025|access-date=18 April 2025|website=Polygon|last=Walker|first=Ian}}</ref>


In June 2025, due to a Trump executive order, Microsoft suspended the email account of an [[International Criminal Court]] prosecutor who was investigating Israel for war crimes.<ref name="ICCsuspend">{{Cite web |date=2025-02-06 |title=Imposing Sanctions on the International Criminal Court |url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/02/imposing-sanctions-on-the-international-criminal-court/ |access-date=2025-06-21 |website=The White House |language=en-US |archive-date=June 22, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250622020231/https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/02/imposing-sanctions-on-the-international-criminal-court/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last1=Satariano |first1=Adam |last2=Smialek |first2=Jeanna |date=2025-06-20 |title=Europe's Growing Fear: How Trump Might Use U.S. Tech Dominance Against It |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2025/06/20/technology/us-tech-europe-microsoft-trump-icc.html |access-date=2025-06-21 |work=The New York Times |language=en-US |issn=0362-4331 |archive-date=June 21, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250621184922/https://www.nytimes.com/2025/06/20/technology/us-tech-europe-microsoft-trump-icc.html |url-status=live }}</ref> According to Microsoft, this decision was made in consultation with the I.C.C., and the company has since enacted policy changes to prevent similar situations in the future, and when four additional I.C.C. judges were sanctioned shortly after, their email accounts were not suspended.<ref name="ICCsuspend"/>
In June 2025, due to a Trump executive order, Microsoft suspended the email account of an [[International Criminal Court]] prosecutor who was investigating Israel for war crimes.<ref name="ICCsuspend">{{Cite web |date=2025-02-06 |title=Imposing Sanctions on the International Criminal Court |url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/02/imposing-sanctions-on-the-international-criminal-court/ |access-date=2025-06-21 |website=The White House |language=en-US |archive-date=June 22, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250622020231/https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/02/imposing-sanctions-on-the-international-criminal-court/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last1=Satariano |first1=Adam |last2=Smialek |first2=Jeanna |date=2025-06-20 |title=Europe's Growing Fear: How Trump Might Use U.S. Tech Dominance Against It |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2025/06/20/technology/us-tech-europe-microsoft-trump-icc.html |access-date=2025-06-21 |work=The New York Times |language=en-US |issn=0362-4331 |archive-date=June 21, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250621184922/https://www.nytimes.com/2025/06/20/technology/us-tech-europe-microsoft-trump-icc.html |url-status=live }}</ref> According to Microsoft, this decision was made in consultation with the ICC, and the company has since enacted policy changes to prevent similar situations in the future, and when four additional ICC judges were sanctioned shortly after, their email accounts were not suspended.<ref name="ICCsuspend"/>


In August 2025, 5 Microsoft workers were fired in connection to protests at Microsoft HQ in Redmond.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Warren |first=Tom |date=2025-09-09 |title=Microsoft fires another employee over Palestine protests. |url=https://www.theverge.com/news/774229/microsoft-fires-another-employee-over-palestine-protests |access-date=2025-11-04 |website=The Verge |language=en-US}}</ref> Microsoft workers set up encampments, establishing a Liberated Zone on the Martyred Palestinian Children's Plaza,<ref>{{Cite web |title=A call for a Worker Intifada {{!}} No Azure for Apartheid |url=https://noazureforapartheid.com/worker-intifada/ |access-date=2025-11-04 |website=noazureforapartheid.com}}</ref> formerly known as the Microsoft East Campus Plaza on August 19th and 20th.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Buncombe |first=Andrew |date=2025-08-20 |title=Microsoft workers occupy HQ in protest against company’s ties to Israeli military |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2025/aug/19/microsoft-workers-protest-washington-israel |access-date=2025-11-04 |work=The Guardian |language=en-GB |issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news '''Halloween Martin''' (October 31, 1900 – February 11, 1987) was an American broadcaster and [[disc jockey]]. She was one of the first disc jockey's in Chicago and an early innovator in what later became known as [[Drive time|morning radio]].<ref name="sies-2003"/> Martin is credited by historian [[Donna Halper]] as the first woman to perform a morning radio show.<ref name="halper-2001"/>
'''Halloween Martin''' (October 31, 1900 – February 11, 1987) was an American broadcaster and [[disc jockey]]. She was one of the first disc jockeys in Chicago and an early innovator in what later became known as [[Drive time|morning radio]].<ref name="sies-2003"/> Martin is credited by historian [[Donna Halper]] as the first woman to perform a morning radio show.<ref name="halper-2001"/>
